TopicTitle: Getting large stock wheels to steer?

Articles.Content:
Hi everyone,

is is there any stock implementation that allows you to get large wheels in stock to steer like the small ones? Is there any way to build some kind of axis that turns in response to A and D?

Thanks,

Harvey.

No, the wheels are made to steer like a tank.

On the bright side, you can turn around on the spot.

Yeah, those ones are rigid. I don't use them all that often, but when I do, I usually add some hefty reaction wheels to the vehicle so that when I'm turning, I can add SAS torque to the (tank-style) wheel steering to help with the turn.

I'm afraid the stock XL3 wheels are fixed in direction, making rovers with them [skid-steer craft](https://www.google.com/search?q=skid-steer). I haven't needed extra reaction wheels for the ones I've built, though I haven't gone truly gigantic with them.
